results.title: The Followers
results.creator_credit: Gilles Blais, Georges Dufaux, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Filmed mainly at the Montreal community of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness, this film revolves around three young Quebecers, Michel, Robert and Johane, from their first days in the temple to their initiation six months later. The film examines the family life of Krishna members, the active proselytising in the streets, the temple rituals, and the role of women and their reliance on men for spiritual guidance. This film affords a close look at one of the controversial new religious organisations to have emerged from the Sixties in the United States. An English version of a French film.

results.title: The Flying doctors [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Charles Tingwell, Graham Moore, Pino Amenta and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: New doctor Harry Callaghan (Andrew McFarlane) arrives for his first day of work with the Royal Flying Doctor Service (RFDS) at Coopers Crossing, resplendent in his white suit. At the same time, New Yorker Liz Drever (Lorna Patterson) makes travel arrangements with her mother to visit the “land down under.” Immediately flying to an emergency with local legend and resident Doctor Harry Sinclair (Keith Eden), the brash Dr. Callaghan finds himself struggling to break through a seemingly impenetrable veneer of locals to gain acceptance, particularly after what transpires on his first day. Presented here is the original four-hour mini series as the medics of Coopers Crossing contend with an array of medical complaints and social situations, not afraid to shy away from topical issues such as domestic abuse, racism and unionism, albeit conservatively. Originally screened in 1985, the series ran successfully on Australian television (and over 50 countries overseas) for five years at a total of 221 episodes - was briefly revived in 1992 as “RFDS” - but only lasted 3 episodes. The series proved profitable for the real RFDS of Australia who earned royalties from the series as well as international exposure. Features a glittering array of Australian actors as regulars and guest stars, including Bill Hunter, Maureen Edwards, Gil Tucker, Lenore Smith, Steve Bisley, Pat Evison, Max Cullen, Maurie Fields, Val Jellay and Bruce Barry to name just a few. Series written by Terry Stapleton.

results.title: The Fly = A Legy
results.brief_description: Creatively animated in sepia print, this Academy Award winning short provides a fly’s eye view of the world. Sensing the approach of autumn, the fly, hoping for safety, takes shelter in a house. Without commentary, sound effects only. Award: AMPAS 1980 Academy Award for Best Animated Short Subject. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Flower and the hive
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Larry Gosnell, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film showing the relationship between the activity of honey bees and the fertility of field and orchard crops. The process of cross-pollination of flowers by bees is observed in close-up. The life of the hive is similarly illustrated, including the curious dance by which a bee communicates the discovery of a new source of nectar to the colony in the hive .
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.V. Durden, Larry Gosnell, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Floating Brothel
results.creator_credit: Mark Lewis, Sonja Armstrong, Essential Viewing, Film Australia and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Based on the 2001 book of the same name by Sian Rees, “The Floating Brothel” tells the story of some of the women transported to Australia on the convict ship The Lady Juliana in 1789. As well as punishment, transportation of the women was supposed to supply the fledgling penal colony with sexual partners for the men already there, with the London Colonial Office ordering the women’s keepers to “promote a matrimonial connection to improve morals and secure settlement”. In the film, the stories of some of the women aboard The Lady Juliana - their backgrounds, their crimes, their journey, their fates in and effects upon the colony - are revealed to three of their modern-day descendants; Australian women who find out more than they bargained for about their convict ancestors. Narrated by Wendy Hughes.

results.title: The Five faces of Kadarwati = Kadarwati
results.creator_credit: Sophan Sophiaan, J. Adisubrata and Gramedia Film
results.brief_description: A melodrama about the oppression of women during the Japanese occupation in Southeast Asia. Leaving for Singapore thinking she is being sent to medical school by the Japanese, Kadarwati arrives only to find she has been picked to serve the Japanese soldiers stationed there. When she finally meets a Japanese officer who is kind to her and with whom she falls in love, he leaves her behind by committing harakiri. After being subject to abuses and torture by Japanese soldiers, she is brought back home to Java where she plots revenge - changing her name and becoming a prostitute at Japanese headquarters. Directed by Sophan Sophiaan, who became a politician and member of Megawati Sukarnoputri’s PDI-P. In Indonesian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Final Academy Documents 1982
results.brief_description: The second video in the ‘Final Academy Documents’ contains William S. Burroughs reading his novel and John Giorno reading his poetry to music recorded at the “Fianl Academy” evening at the Hacienda Club in Manchester in 1982.

results.title: The Flight of the snows
results.creator_credit: Jean-Louis Frund, Donald Duprey, International Cinemedia Centre Ltd and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The snow goose is a tightly scheduled bird. It winters in the United States, flies 4,000 kilometres to breed and raise a family in the high Arctic, and returns before the frost sets in. This film documents the formation-flying, feeding habits, rearing of young and lifestyle of the great snow goose. Written by Joseph Koenig; music by James Solkin; voice and narration by Bud Knapp.

results.title: The Final academy documents 1962/63
results.brief_description: Contains archival film footage of William S. Burroughs and Brion Gysin, filmed by the late Anthony Balch in 1962-1963. Includes “Ghosts at Number 9” and the classic film “Towers Open Fire”.
